conclusion: Analyze the motion of the mover and the forces acting on it during the acceleration phase.
Determine the magnetic force on the mover using the formula F_B = n B l I.
Given values: n = 100, B = 0.1 T, l = 1 m.
Calculate the magnetic force as F_B = 10I.
Determine the net force on the mover as F_net = F_B - F.
Retraction force F is given as F = 800 - 10v.
Calculate retraction force at t_1 = 1.5 s as F = 800 N.
Determine the acceleration of the mover using F_net = ma.
Total mass of the mover and coil is m = 5 kg.
Determine the velocity-time relationship using v = at.
Velocity at t_1 = 1.5 s is zero.
Determine the current I using v_1 = a t_3.
Velocity at t_3 is v_1 = 80 m/s.
Assume t_3 = 3 s based on symmetry of velocity-time relationship.
Substitute a back into the equation to find I.
Final answer: The current I of the constant current source is 106.67 A.
